page.title: 16CHIRNSIDE CIVIC WEEK
page.content: Chirnside Civic Week, founded in 1979, is organised by a committee of villagers. It starts on a Sunday. From the East End decorated floats and people in fancy dress parade around the village behind the queen's float. The queen, chosen by her fellow pupils, and a fairy queen are crowned by a well-known member of the village rather than by a celebrity. After the ceremony, Highland Games competitions are held along with a professional running meeting, which many people attend. Throughout the week there are many activities for young and old. These include football for children and "Old Crocks", a pet show, a children's fancy dress competition, a BMX competition, children's sports, and quiz games like "Mr and Mrs".
